div.p: ALLAN: Research has found that using narcotics such as morphine, heroin, or Oxycodone --sometimes taken as oxycontin-- also impairs driving skills.
ALLAN: Impairment effects include reduced alertness, reduced attention, and poor eye control.
ALLAN: But if people have been usinf over a period of time and built up a tollerance they may start to feel it is safe to drive.

ALLAN: Research has found that amoung experianced at injecting drug users, 88% reported driving under the influence drugs in the previous year and nearly 1 in 10 had a drug related crash in that time.
